title: Territory Manager DACH
content:
Location Flexible Munich, Amsterdam
The Role
GoPro is seeking a top tier candidate for the EMEA Territory Manager role. This position will be responsible for managing existing business as well as accounts under development. This is a hands-on, individual contributor role focused on driving increased revenue. In addition, the Territory Manager will develop strong partnerships and execute integrated sales and marketing plans with strategic partners. The ideal candidate will love working with internal counterparts in a collaborative, creative, fast paced environment to overachieve sales goals and targets.
 
What You Will Do

Lead account management and joint business planning for assigned retail and Distribution partners
Achieve the Company’s ambitious growth plans in terms of both revenue growth and profitability of sales
Collaborative forecasting with retailers to ensure healthy inventory levels (WOS) and maximize turn
Maintain regular communications both internally and externally to review forecasts, orders, promotions, and inventory metrics
Drive potential channel expansion strategies
Must be able to travel as necessary for the position

 
Skills We’re Excited About

6-8 years of Sales Account Management across a variety of verticals to understand and implement the best sales strategy to achieve company goals.
Experience across any of the following: Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Poland    
Understanding of the marketplace, the unique challenges plus currency and exchange rate impact.
Ability to demonstrate year-on-year sales growth under their jurisdiction.
Ability to effect substantial positive change in a short timescale.
Ability to multi-task in a rapidly changing, fast paced environment.
Multilingual
Passionate about GoPro. 

 
Bonus Points For

Experience working directly with large retailers in Germany, Switzerland or Poland

 
Why Work With Us?

Create your own destiny. GoPro enables you and trusts you to get your own job done, because we believe that autonomy in role brings out the best in our employees.
Live your best life. We’ve adopted remote and flexible work arrangements to support work at GoPro alongside our commitment to supporting employee wellbeing, belonging and connection with one another.
Work with leading edge technologies. We encourage employees to cultivate and use the latest and greatest technology, to provide the best solutions to serve our customers. We celebrate creative solutions that bring innovation to GoPro technology.

 
GoPro Highlights

Get your very own GoPro camera + gear;
Competitive salary and discretionary annual performance-related bonus;
Gym fee compensation;
Discounted employee stock purchase plan.
Professional + personal development opportunities, i.e. LinkedIn Learning
Opportunities to get involved in the causes that you care about (annual camera donation + volunteer events)
Outside’s Best Places to Work No. 1 Large Employer 2021

 
We strive for the day that no group can be described as underrepresented at GoPro – whether as part of our brand or in our workforce. We are committed to providing a more inclusive, representative, equal, just and happy world. GoPro is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
#LI-Remote #flexible #LI-CS1

questions.label: How did you hear about this job?

questions.description:
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by a GoPro legal entity located in the EU (“Controller”). Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of (EU) 2016/679 General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.

Your personal data may be shared with a limited number of cloud services providers located in the USA and engaged by Controller, solely for the purposes of recruitment and hiring on Controllers behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the USA, your personal data may be transferred to the USA once you submit it through this site. Because the European Commission has determined that USA data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer, if any, will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under the GDPR.

Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority. You can address any questions about your privacy by emailing to privacy@gopro.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
